name: Limbang Regional Museum (Old Fort)
features: Housed in a reconstructed 1897 fort, this museum showcases archaeological finds and ethnic artifacts, offering insights into the region's history and culture.
address: Approximately 200 meters upriver from the Limbang River
businessHours: 09:00 AM – 04:45 PM (Monday to Friday); 10: 00 AM - 04: 00 PM (Saturday, Sunday, and public holidays)

name: Limpaki Wetland
features: An estuarine mangrove forest teeming with wildlife such as proboscis monkeys, crocodiles, and fireflies. Activities include canoeing, wildlife watching, and visits to nearby longhouses.
address: Near Kampung Limpaki, about 15 km from Limbang town

name: Bukit Mas (Gold Hill) & Tasik Bukit Mas
features: Playgrounds, picnic areas, and a Buddhist shrine halfway up the hill

name: Kampung Meritam Mud Volcanoes
features: Unique volcanic mud pools believed to have therapeutic properties. Visitors can enjoy mud baths in crater-like formations.
